item.title: art of rally studio Funselektor announces off-road exploration game over the hill for PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/art-of-rally-studio-funselektor-announces-off-road-exploration-game-over-the-hill-for-pc

  • PC

Developed in cooperation with Strelka Games.

art of rally developer Funselektor and Strelka Games have announced free-roaming off-road exploration game over the hill for PC (Steam). A release date was not announced.

“After having developed several games about motorsport, we wanted to go off-track by offering players a vast world to lose themselves at a slower pace,” said Funselektor founder Dune Casu in a press release. “In a way, this game is similar to the experience I’ve had journeying across North America in my trusty camper van. There’s something special about being in the wilderness in the middle of nowhere, from the peace, the sounds of nature and less distraction from the civilized world. I hope this game can really drive that feeling home.”

  • ❮
  • ❯

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Explore, navigate, and uncover the vast wilderness in over the hill, the newest installation from the creator of art of rally. Ramble your way through varied biomes inspired by real-world locations, from valleys to mountains and everything in between.

Key Features

  • A World of Discovery – Discover portals to travel to new areas, and complete objectives to unlock new vehicles, upgrades, customizations, and cosmetics, with many combinations to try. Who knows, maybe you’ll find some hidden gems along the way.
  • Multi or Single Player – Take a friend or go on a solo tour. Challenge yourself, collaborate with up to three friends, or just enjoy the sights – the world is your oyster.
  • Pitch Up – Fancy a break? Why not plan your next excursion with your friends?! Set up a campsite for some much-needed R&R after a long day in the elements. Gather your friends around the campfire, grab a hot cocoa, and catch up on the day’s events.
  • Adapt and Overcome – Take on the elements with dynamic weather, day/night cycles, and realistic terrain deformation. Find solace in nature, even when you’re stuck in the mud.
  • It’s About the Journey – The best stories never start at the end. With so much to explore and uncover, it’s all about the cruise. Complete all the objectives, unlock the many customizations and upgrades, and discover everything the wilderness has to offer. Just take your time and find peace in the minimalistic serenity.
  • Capture the Beauty – Grab stills of your favorite landscapes with the built-in photo mode. We can’t wait to follow your journey. You never know what you may discover just over the hill.

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.

Announce Trailer

item.title: Pokemon Trading Card Game Pocket adds ‘Trade’ feature on January 29, ‘Space-Time Smackdown’ expansion on January 29
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/pokemon-trading-card-game-pocket-adds-trade-feature-on-january-29-space-time-smackdown-expansion-on-january-29

  • Smartphone

Swap cards with friends.

The Pokemon Company will release an update for Pokemon Trading Card Game Pocket on January 29 that adds the long-awaited “Trade” feature to the game, followed by the new expansion “Space-Time Smackdown” on January 30, the company announced.

Here is an overview of each addition, via The Pokemon Company:

Trade Feature

The new trade feature will allow players to trade their digital Pokemon cards with friends, broadening ways to grow their Pokemon Trading Card Game Pocket card collections. Upon release of the feature, players will be able to trade cards from the “Genetic Apex” and “Mythical Island” expansion, with plans in place to expand the lineup of tradeable cards in the future.

Expansion “Space-Time Smackdown”

Featuring the Legendary Pokemon Dialga and Palkia, Space-Time Smackdown invites players to discover Pokemon from the Sinnoh region. In the expansion, players can expect unique card illustrations featuring fan-favorite Pokemon, including Turtwig, Chimchar, Piplup, and Lucario.

Pokemon Trading Card Game Pocket is available now for iOS via App Store and Android via Google Play

Watch a trailer for the expansion below.

Expansion “Space-Time Smackdown” Announce Trailer

English

Japanese

item.title: Among the Trolls launches in Early Access in 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/among-the-trolls-launches-in-early-access-in-2025

  • PC

Survival adventure game published by 505 Pulse.

Among the Trolls, the 2022-announced first-person survival action adventure game, will launch in Early Access for PC via Steam in 2025, publisher 505 Pulse and developer Avantgarden Games announced.

While Among the Trolls was originally planned to be published by 505 Games, publishing has moved to Digital Bros‘ independent games-focused 505 Pulse label. Additionally, after the closure of original developer Forbidden Studio, the team that laid the groundwork for the game decided to keep supporting the project by entrusting it to Avantgarden Games, which started from scratch in 2024 and moved the project from Unity to Unreal Engine.

“We’re thrilled to collaborate with Avantgarden on reigniting the Among the Trolls project,” said 505 Pulse senior global brand manager Fabrizio Faraoni in a press release. “They embraced the concept with passion. There was a community of players, eager to know more about the status of the project. We worked for a long time behind the scenes, and we are finally ready to show early glimpses of the game they are putting together. A truly unique experience that blends survival mechanics, rich storytelling over the stunning Finnish landscape.”

Avantgarden Games creative director Girgio Macellari added, “We see Among the Trolls as an opportunity to deliver a different take on the survival genre and shape it with the help of its dedicated community. Our partnership with 505 Pulse allows us to deliver this vision to a global audience.”

  • ❮
  • ❯

Here is an overview of the game, via 505 Pulse:

About

Set on a secluded Finnish archipelago, Among the Trolls invites players to explore lush forests, survive against the odds, and unravel ancient mysteries tied to their lost relatives. The game emphasizes a dynamic, living world where player actions not only affect survival but also influence the environment and its creatures.

Among the Trolls offers a compelling mix of exploration, survival, and storytelling that stands out in today’s gaming landscape. By launching on Steam Early Access, the development team aims to involve the gaming community in shaping the game’s evolution, ensuring a polished and engaging final experience.

Key Features

  • Immersive Survival Gameplay – Gather resources, craft tools, and hone your survival skills in a dynamic world that responds to your actions.
  • Dynamic Exploration – Discover hidden paths, solve environmental puzzles, and encounter mythical beings in a richly detailed Finnish wilderness.
  • Living Ecosystem – Thrive in harmony with a nature that reacts to your choices, offering a unique blend of exploration and strategy.
  • Compelling Narrative – Gradually uncover the truth behind your relative’s disappearance and the ancient lore of the Nordic forests.

Watch a new teaser trailer below. View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.

Teaser Trailer

item.title: Famitsu Sales: 1/13/25 – 1/19/25
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/famitsu-sales-1-13-25-1-19-25

  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Donkey Kong Country Returns HD opens at 107,093 retail copies sold.

Famitsu has published its estimated physical game software data for Japan for the weeks of January 13, 2025 to January 19, 2025.

Donkey Kong Country Returns HD for Switch was the highest selling new release of the week, opening at 107,093 retail copies sold. It was followed by Dynasty Warriors: Origins for PlayStation 5, which opened at 63,805 retail units.

Also new this week, Tales of Graces f Remastered opened at 25,701 copies on Switch and 15,669 copies on PlayStation 5 for an opening week total of 41,370 retail copies sold.

On the hardware side, the Switch family sold 47,560 units, the PlayStation 5 family sold 10,738 units, the Xbox Series family sold 785 units, and the PlayStation 4 family sold 29 units.

Get the full sales charts below.

Software Sales (followed by lifetime sales)

  1. [NSW] Donkey Kong Country Returns HD (Nintendo, 01/16/25) – 107,093 (New)
  2. [PS5] Dynasty Warriors: Origins (Koei Tecmo, 01/17/25) – 63,805 (New)
  3. [NSW] Tales of Graces f Remastered (Bandai Namco, 01/16/25) – 25,701 (New)
  4. [NSW] Super Mario Party Jamboree (Nintendo, 10/17/24) – 23,154 (1,121,410)
  5. [PS5] Tales of Graces f Remastered (Bandai Namco, 01/17/25) – 15,669 (New)
  6. [NSW] Mario Kart 8 Deluxe (Nintendo, 04/28/17) – 8,426 (6,215,983)
  7. [NSW] Dragon Quest III HD-2D Remake (Square Enix, 11/14/24) – 7,467 (979,980)
  8. [NSW] Animal Crossing: New Horizons (Nintendo, 03/20/20) – 6,967 (8,051,842)
  9. [NSW] Minecraft (Microsoft, 06/21/18) – 6,274 (3,792,302)
  10. [PS5] SYNDUALITY: Echo of Ada Deluxe Edition (Bandai Namco, 01/16/25) – 5,197 (New)

Rankings 11 to 30 will be announced on January 24.

  1. [NSW] Kenka Bancho Otome Double Pack (Spike Chunsoft, 01/16/25) – (New)
  2. [NSW] YOBARAI Detective: Miasma Breaker (Mebius, 01/16/25) – (New)

item.title: Pocketpair establishes Pocketpair Publishing, announces first title with Surgent Studios
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/pocketpair-establishes-pocketpair-publishing-announces-first-title-with-surgent-studios

Horror title due out in 2025.

Pocketpair has announced the establishment of Pocketpair Publishing, a new publishing business that will support game development through funding, development assistance, and publishing for independent developers and studios. Its first project will be a new horror title from Tales of Kenzera: ZAU developer Surgent Studios, scheduled to release in 2025.

Get the details below.

About Pocketpair Publishing

Pocketpair Publishing provides comprehensive support for game development through funding, development assistance, and publishing for indie game developers and small studios. Pocketpair Publishing promises to take a hands-off approach, providing as much support as developers need without overstepping or imposing strict conditions on the development process.

Supporting New Title From Surgent Studios

Pocketpair Publishing’s first project will be supporting a brand new title from the United Kingdom-based studio Surgent Studios which is scheduled to release later in 2025.

Surgent Studios is a studio that has been garnering attention for its original approach to storytelling, founded by renowned British actor and video game developer Abubakar Salim. Pocketpair Publishing has provided the necessary development funding and support so that Surgent Studios’ next title can realize its full potential.

A Message to Developers From John “Bucky” Buckley, Head of Pocketpair Publishing

“At Pocketpair, there is nothing we love more than games, and Pocketpair Publishing is our latest venture to help the world enjoy gaming even more. Game development comes with many challenges, but we want to ease that process as much as possible and provide an environment where creators can pursue their dreams.

“We are pleased to be able to support SURGENT STUDIOS’ new title as our first step. We deeply sympathize with their original ideas and passion and are honored to help them realize their vision. We will respect the autonomy and vision of developers and work together to make great games for people all over the world.

“We sincerely hope that more creators will be able to realize their dreams through Pocketpair Publishing.”

A Message From Abubakar Salim, CEO of Surgent Studios

“We noticed a pattern in the entertainment industry, and Pocketpair has given us the opportunity to make a horror game about it. Both Surgent and Pocketpair are well-versed in taking risks. This game will be short and weird, and we think players will be interested in what we have to say.

“We’re still in earnest conversation about further projects set in the Tales of Kenzera universe, but this will be a standalone piece: a mile marker between where we’ve come from and where we’re going.”
